readme.text:
React Ludum Dare
===========
[![img](https://wdp9fww0r9.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/production/badge/woofers/react-ludum-dare)](https://wdp9fww0r9.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/production/results/woofers/react-ludum-dare) [![img](https://david-dm.org/woofers/react-ludum-dare.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-ludum-dare) [![img](https://badge.fury.io/js/react-ludum-dare.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-ludum-dare) [![img](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/react-ludum-dare.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-ludum-dare) [![img](https://img.shields.io/npm/l/react-ludum-dare.svg)](https://github.com/woofers/react-ludum-dare/blob/master/License.txt)

Display Ludum Dare Game Jam results in React.

**[Live Demo](https://jaxson.vandoorn.ca/react-ludum-dare/)**

**Note:** This project is community made and not endorsed by the offical Ludum Dare creator(s).

![img](./screenshots/widget.png "Widget")


# Installation

**Yarn**

    yarn add react-ludum-dare

**npm**

    npm install react-ludum-dare


# Usage

```jsx
import React from 'react'
import Widget from 'react-ludum-dare'

const App = () => (
  <Widget name="44/alien-e-x-p-a-n-s-i-o-n"
          usePlaceholder={false}
  />
)
```

Simply add the game widget to the React application using JSX.


## Props


### Game

The namespace of the game on the ldjam site **Required**

`game` requires both the Ludum Dare number and the game title (eg. `44/alien-e-x-p-a-n-s-i-o-n`  for Ludum Dare 44)


### Use Placeholder

`usePlaceholder` indicates if placeholder content should be used when loading. **Default:** `false`

If un-set the component will simply be hidden until data is loaded from the Ludum Dare API.

Display Ludum Dare Game Jam results in React.

*[[https://jaxson.vandoorn.ca/react-ludum-dare/][Live Demo]]*

*Note:* This project is community made and not endorsed by the offical Ludum Dare creator(s).

#+CAPTION: Widget
#+ATTR_HTML: :style margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
[[./screenshots/widget.png]]

* Installation

*Yarn*
#+BEGIN_SRC
yarn add react-ludum-dare
#+END_SRC

*npm*
#+BEGIN_SRC
npm install react-ludum-dare
#+END_SRC

* Usage

#+BEGIN_SRC js
import React from 'react'
import Widget from 'react-ludum-dare'

const App = () => (
  <Widget name="44/alien-e-x-p-a-n-s-i-o-n"
          usePlaceholder={false}
  />
)
#+END_SRC

Simply add the game widget to the React application using JSX.

** Props
*** Game
The namespace of the game on the ldjam site *Required*

~game~ requires both the Ludum Dare number and the game title (eg. ~44/alien-e-x-p-a-n-s-i-o-n~  for Ludum Dare 44)
*** Use Placeholder
~usePlaceholder~ indicates if placeholder content should be used when loading. *Default:* ~false~

If un-set the component will simply be hidden until data is loaded from the Ludum Dare API.
